page.title: 01The Hills around Beverley
page.content: The area is very hilly and is mainly rough grazing and moorland. Coldstones quarry is near the top of the hill and employs about twelve people. About a thousand tons of limestone are esxtracted a day from the quarry. This is used for road chipping and chemical processes. Many houses which have been direlict have been bought by commuters in recent years and are now being restored and moved into. None of the land is cultivated but is just used for grazing cattle and sheep. The moors are used for breeding grouse as the soil is too poor to support much vegetation and is therefore unsuitable for sheep. The village of Beverely is scattered along the green and has an ancient chapel. In square No. 8 there is Yorke's Falley which was build to create employment.
